main event: A civilian pilot observed a highly polished silver oval UFO over Battle Creek, Michigan, on October 21, 1951.
interesting points: The object was at an altitude of about 3,000 feet and appeared to dive sharply before measurements could be taken., The pilot reported no sound or vapor trail accompanying the object., The UFO passed overhead at approximately 1,000 feet., The object's course was described as straight, and it was observed for about 3.5 seconds., Radar installations did not detect the object, possibly due to its high speed.
sighted object: one highly polished silver oval object
